page.title: 13Farming(1)
page.content: The two main crops grown on our farm are barley and potatoes. We grow Spring Barley. This is sown in late March or early April depending upon the weather.If Spring has been wet sowing is done alittle later. The land has to be ploughed and cultivated or rotavated.Sometimes it is sprayed with a chemical called "Round Up" which kills off weeds, even the stubborn roots of couch grass. After sowing the land is harrowed. This spreads the seed more evenly. It is then raked to cover the seeds and to smooth out the surface of the soil.Chemical fertiliser is put down. This is very expensive.Spraying is done several times during the summer to protect the ears of corn. You can tell that this is necessary because the young shoots are too pale a green in colour. In late August or early September the barley is ready.(Contd.)
